title: WHY IS SORAKA EVEN ALLOWED TO HEAL MINIONS
body:
DOES THIS FUCKING EXIST JUST TO MAKE ME MISCLICK

OH LOOK MY LEES AT 20 HEALTH

My favorite part about soraka is her ability to completely fuck with the enemy laner by healing the minions they are trying to last hit. I can sometimes get them to rage quit, and my adc usually comes out of laning phase at least 20 CS ahead. You have a mechanism to get health back; use it. In fact, the more YOU focus CS denial, the more the enemy focuses getting their cs before you can heal, which leaves a very predictable pattern and actually makes it easier to hit your Q. 


I suggest you adapt your playstyle and give it a try. It works wonders. heal cs, hit q, repeat.
This separates good Soraka players from bad ones.
More accurately, it separates the players that know you can target allies for heals via their portraits on the side.

The problem is that Riot needs to make targeted abilities better at prioritizing, not that some healers can heal minions. All targeted abilities are affected by this— minions cover up too much of a champion's "targeting" hitbox.

There's a modifier you can press so it only targets champions, really useful to get behind jungle monsters without attacking. I have no idea which key it's on your keyboard, mine uses a Swedish layout so it's completely different. Just look in the controls and it should be there.
I had no idea. I need to find this key immediately! Though for Soraka specifically the portrait healing works really well.

You'd be surprised how few know about using the portraits, it's really freaking useful. That is actually my main gripe of Heroes of the Storm, there's no team portraits so you can't tell if someone on the other side of the map needs help. You have to click on the mini-map and stop what you're doing to look.

I used to be really into MMOs and would occasionally play a healer (tanking and melee DPS were my favorite roles); portrait healing was critical especially in raids where the screen is a giant mess. I found out about this in league when playing Soraka for the first time and falling back on old habits. Had I not had the MMO background, I never would have thought to try it.

There are a lot of neat things in this game, but very little in the ways of documentation. For example, I was level 30 before I figured out what the green light on the portrait icon meant. For those who don't know, it is an ultimate indicator, which shows that your teammate has their ULT available.
Sometimes i'll purposely heal a tank minion or another minion to screw up last hits.  Or you can screw up an obvious Irelia Q if she's chasing.
i like to heal my minions when the enemy adc is trying to cs, it makes them very mad
10% of your max health isn't worth denying a single creep.
Saying 10% of hp is a really one-sided way of putting that, when you say 70-80 hp you realize hitting a Q restores that.

Well, if you want to always heal up a certain ally 100% without the risk of misclicking, you can always press W on their champion portrait (I do this if we're in teamfights and everyone's clumped up).

As for /why/ she can: you can use this to push minion waves to tower when you know they have backed/died, or you can even deny cs every once in a while. Emote-laughing when I deny them a cannon minion is fun :^)

First of all, you severely underestimate the power of healing a minion.  Like someone else said, you can really screw with someone's farm pattern if you heal a minion.  Also, it can be the difference between taking a turret or not.  

Second, you do know that you can just click heal on the icons to the left, right?  Whomever you want to heal, just go to that icon and quick cast on them.  

Third, I believe there is a quick command that you can toggle to just target champions.  Could be wrong, though.
